_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Effingaham Equity is committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anyhdrous ammonia.  Our prevention program includes the use of proper epuipment, regular inspections and maintenance and training for all employees that work with the material.  Should an accidental release occur, the facility has oriented the Robinson Fire Dept. and the Crawford County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC).  These steps have been taken to assure a quick response to any release and minimize the impact of the release to our community and environment.

The primary activity at the facility is the storage of anhydrous ammonia for sale to farmers.  Anyhdrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for direct application as a crop production nutrient.  

This facility has developed a worst case and alternate case scenario, however it has been withheld from this Executive Summary as security sensitive information as requested by the EPA.

Effingham Equity complies with all rules and regulations relating to the handling of anhydrous ammonia including the Illinois Department of Agriculture regulations as well as OSHA 29 CFR 1910.111 regarding proper storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia.  

There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia for the covered process in the past five years.

Effingham Equity has a written emergency action plan in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR- 1919.38.  Emergency planning and community right to know information is provided to the Illinois Emergency Management Agency, LEPC, and local fire department as required by SARA Title III of EPCRA.

Improving safety at Effingham Equity is an on-going process.  Periodic evaluations are perfomed to assess the maintenance of safe practices and operations.  There are no additional specific anhydrous ammonia safety recommendations for implementation at this time.
